intro: Ammi glaucifolium, commonly known as blueleaf cowbane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
